tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE equipment_sensor_data (
  equipment_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  sensor_id INT,
  sensor_type VARCHAR(50),
  sensor_value FLOAT,
  timestamp TIMESTAMP
)

CREATE TABLE Maintenance_Log (
    log_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    equipment_id INT,
    maintenance_description TEXT,
    maintenance_date DATE
    FOREIGN KEY (equipment_id) REFERENCES Equipment_Sensor_Data(equipment_id)
);

CREATE TABLE Equipment_Sensors (
  equipment_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  sensor_id INT,
  sensor_name VARCHAR(50),
  last_reading TIMESTAMP
)

CREATE TABLE Downtime_Records (
  record_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  equipment_id INT,
  downtime_start TIMESTAMP,
  downtime_end TIMESTAMP,
  reason TEXT
)

CREATE TABLE Maintenance_Schedule (
  schedule_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  equipment_id INT,
  maintenance_type VARCHAR(50),
  scheduled_date DATE
)

CREATE TABLE equipment (
  equipment_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  equipment_name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
  equipment_type VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
  manufacturing_date DATE,
  last_maintenance_date DATE
)

CREATE TABLE sensor_data (
  sensor_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  equipment_id INT,
  sensor_type VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
  sensor_value FLOAT,
  recorded_at TIMESTAMP
)

CREATE TABLE maintenance_logs (
  log_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  equipment_id INT,
  maintenance_date DATE,
  maintenance_description TEXT
)

CREATE TABLE downtime_logs (
  log_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  equipment_id INT,
  downtime_start TIMESTAMP,
  downtime_end TIMESTAMP
)

CREATE TABLE equipment_sensor_data (
    equipment_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    sensor_id INT,
    sensor_reading FLOAT,
    reading_timestamp TIMESTAMP,
    location VARCHAR(50)
)

CREATE TABLE maintenance_logs (
    log_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    equipment_id INT,
    maintenance_type VARCHAR(50),
    maintenance_date DATE,
    maintenance_description TEXT
)

CREATE TABLE downtime_records (
    record_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    equipment_id INT,
    downtime_start TIMESTAMP,
    downtime_end TIMESTAMP,
    downtime_reason TEXT
)

CREATE TABLE maintenance_schedule (
    schedule_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    equipment_id INT,
    last_maintenance_date DATE,
    suggested_maintenance_date DATE,
    maintenance_required BOOLEAN
)

CREATE TABLE sensor_thresholds (
    threshold_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    sensor_id INT,
    parameter_name VARCHAR(50),
    threshold_value FLOAT
)
